intro: Doemia guineensis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of 10–30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, white, and blue, and are often used in ornamental gardening. Doemia guineensis thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
